description: Borrowed from Latin praedictivus, from praedico. Equivalent to predict +â€Ž -ive.

adjectives.description: predictive (comparative more predictive, superlative most predictive)

examples: The amount of rain in April is predictive of the number of mosquitoes in May.

entries.meaning: (medicine) Expressing the expected accuracy of a statistical measure or of a diagnostic test.
(grammar) A conditional statement that includes a prediction in the dependent clause (e.g. "if it rains, the game will be cancelled", "give her an inch and she'll take a mile.").
(statistics) Simulated data generated from a statistical model, based on the estimates for the real data.
